action.action-desc: Mr. Gallego (for himself, Ms. Lee, Ms. Norton, Mr. Van Hollen, Mr. Cummings, Mr. Walz, Mrs. Beatty, Mr. Cartwright, Mr. Serrano, Ms. Schakowsky, and Mr. Clay) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to prohibit the display of the Confederate battle flag in national cemeteries.

section.header: Prohibition on display of Confederate battle flag in national cemeteries

paragraph.text: The Confederate battle flag is a potent reminder of a deeply divisive period of our Nation’s history, recalling the human suffering of slavery and Jim Crow.
For millions of Americans, including veterans and their families, the Confederate battle flag is a symbol of intolerance, injustice, and inequality.

Flying the Confederate battle flag, originally the banner of forces fighting the armies of the United States, is offensive and inappropriate at cemeteries and other sites dedicated to the memory of America’s courageous war dead.

subsection.text: Chapter 24 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Prohibition on display of Confederate battle flag
section.text: The Secretary shall prohibit the display of the Confederate battle flag in any national cemetery under the control of the National Cemetery Administration.

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 2415. Prohibition on display of Confederate battle flag.
